author: DISNEY TOM
description: The Lakshadweep administration plans to acquire Bitra Island for defense purposes, sparking opposition from residents and MP Hamdullah Sayeed. A social impact assessment has been ordered by the revenue department, citing the island's strategic location and national security relevance.
title: Govt plans defence ‘takeover’ of Lakshadweep island

author: TNN
description: Ahead of the Monsoon session, Union ministers strategized on key issues like Bihar's electoral rolls, the Pahalgam attack, and Operation Sindoor, amidst opposition pressure. Congress demands parliamentary discussion on the Pahalgam terror attack and seeks clarity on Operation Sindoor following claims made by Donald Trump. The INDIA bloc is set to meet online to strategize before the session begins.
title: Monsoon session: BJP brass chalk out plan; Cong demands 2-day Pahalgam debate

author: DHANANJAY MAHAPATRA
description: The Supreme Court has expressed strong disapproval over delays in trials for NIA-investigated terrorism and heinous crime cases. It criticized the practice of designating existing courts for these cases, demanding the Union and Maharashtra governments establish new, exclusive special courts by September. Failure to comply may result in the courts considering bail for the accused due to trial delays.
title: Set up NIA courts or will give accused bail, SC warns govt; raps trial delays

author: DHANANJAY MAHAPATRA
description: Justice Yashwant Varma has approached the Supreme Court to quash an inquiry report that found him guilty of possessing illicit cash at his residence. He challenges the constitutionality of the recommendation to remove him from his judgeship. Varma questions the in-house procedure, arguing it violates the constitutional power of Parliament to remove judges through impeachment.
title: Varma moves SC for quashing of inquiry report, questions in-house procedure validity

author: KSHITIZ
description: Bihar police are hunting for five shooters involved in the brazen murder of gangster Chandan Mishra at a Patna hospital. Authorities have identified Tausif Badshah as the main gunman and suspect Onkarnath alias Sheru Singh, currently jailed in Bengal, orchestrated the crime due to suspicions that Mishra was informing police.
title: 24 hours on, shooters of Bihar gangster still at large

author: HARVEER DABAS
description: In a tragic incident at Uttam Sugar Mill in Bijnor's Barkatpur, three workers died while cleaning an effluent treatment plant. Supervisor Muneshwar Singh and two factory workers, Kapil Dev and Sopal Singh, succumbed to poisonous gases inside the tank. Another worker, Prabhat Kumar, was severely injured during a rescue attempt, prompting accusations of safety negligence against the factory management.
title: 3 killed while cleaning sugar mill’s effluent treatment unit

author: ATUL THAKUR
description: Indian farmers face a challenging situation with stagnant income and declining profit margins across major crops, as revealed by CACP data. While input costs have risen, the increase in farm income hasn't kept pace with rural inflation over the last decade. Consequently, profit margins have decreased for most crops, exacerbating the financial strain on farmers, especially those with small landholdings.
title: Agri income stagnates: Costs outpace gains for farmers; margins fall across crops

author: HEMANTA PRADHAN, DEBABRATA MOHAPATRA, KISHAN SAHU
description: A probe into the self-immolation of a 20-year-old student in Balasore, Odisha, revealed she had accused her HoD of seeking sexual favors six months prior. College authorities were informed in June, but the HoD denied the allegations. Multiple investigations are underway, including those by UGC, higher education committees, and the crime branch.
title: Balasore student told ex-principal about harassment 6 months ago

author: TNN
description: A 52-year-old bank manager from Prayagraj was discovered deceased in his Baramati office, Maharashtra, on Thursday. Police reported that a suicide note attributed the act to intense work pressure, though no individuals were named. The note urged the bank to alleviate employee stress, acknowledging their full commitment. He had also applied for voluntary retirement.
title: Bank manager in Baramati ends life citing ‘work pressure’

author: TNN
description: Home Minister Amit Shah announced that India is bidding for the 2036 Olympics, Commonwealth Games, and Asian Games, aiming to integrate sports into daily life. The government is providing monthly stipends of Rs 50,000 to 3,000 athletes to prepare for the Olympics, with the goal of being among the top five nations in the medal tally.
title: Eye on Olympics, 3,000 sportsmen getting Rs 50k/mth: Amit Shah

author: TNN
title: India commissions indigenously built diving support vessel

author: PRIYANKA KAKODKAR
description: Following a clash between supporters of NCP (SP) MLA Jitendra Awhad and BJP MLA Gopichand Padalkar in Vidhan Bhavan, both leaders apologized as directed by Speaker Rahul Narwekar. Narwekar, taking a stern stance, has initiated measures including a privileges committee investigation for involved supporters and restricted access to the House during sessions.
title: Maha speaker makes NCP (SP), BJP MLAs apologise for scuffle

author: TNN
description: The Ministry of Rural Development has directed states to improve monitoring of the National Mobile Monitoring System (NMMS) for MGNREGA, citing instances of misuse and manipulation. Discrepancies like irrelevant photo uploads and repeated worker photos raise concerns about accountability and potential financial irregularities. Congress has criticized the NMMS, demanding its withdrawal and reaffirmation of task-based payments.
title: MGNREGS mobile monitoring being fudged, govt tells states

author: TNN
title: Migrant worker from Jharkhand killed in Niger terror attack

author: RAJ SHEKHAR JHA
description: Indian missiles struck Pakistan's Rahim Yar Khan airbase during Operation Sindoor, rendering it non-operational for over two months. The strategic airbase, vital for Pakistan's southern air defense, sustained significant damage, as evidenced by repeated extensions of runway closure notices. Other airbases and a terror camp were also targeted, impacting Pakistan's military infrastructure.
title: Op Sindoor: Pak’s Rahim Yar Khan base still shut; runway unusable till Aug 5

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Marcus “Buff” Bagwell, a veteran WWE wrestler, had his leg amputated. The surgery happened on July 10, 2025. This was due to issues from a car accident in 2020. The accident in Georgia caused many injuries. Bagwell had almost 30 surgeries. Infections and pain continued. Doctors said the leg could not be saved. Bagwell wrestled for 34 years.
title: Buff Bagwell: WWE legend’s leg amputation stuns fans; years of pain end in major surgery

author: TUSHAR TERE
description: In Vadodara, a private tutor, Jasbirsinh Chauhan, received a six-month jail sentence and a ₹1 lakh fine for severely injuring a 15-year-old student. Chauhan repeatedly slapped the boy, causing torn eardrums and bleeding, after the student missed classes. The father, Tejas Bhatt, filed a complaint leading to Chauhan's arrest in January 2020. The court convicted Chauhan after extensive legal proceedings.
title: Corporal punishment gets Gujarat private tutor 6 months jail, Rs 1 lakh fine

author: TNN
description: Enforcement Directorate searched 22 de-addiction centers across Punjab. The searches happened due to illegal sale of drugs by these centers. Dr. Amit Bansal is the prime accused. He allegedly sold drugs from his de-addiction centers. Rupinder Kaur, a drug inspector, is also under investigation. She allegedly provided incorrect inspection reports.
title: ED raids 22 Punjab de-addiction centres for illegal sale of drugs

author: BHARTI JAIN
description: The Employees’ State Insurance Corporation has hired 451 individuals. They were selected for insurance medical officer positions. The recruitment occurred through the UPSC’s Pratibha Setu portal. This portal contains a talent pool of candidates. These candidates cleared UPSC exams but weren't recommended. The Pratibha Setu initiative helps connect such candidates with employers. It offers opportunities to those with high qualifications.
title: ESIC picks up 451 who failed to make UPSC’s final cut

author: DIPAWALI MITRA AND SUJOY KHANRA
description: A fourth-year IIT-Kharagpur student, Ritam Mondal, was discovered dead in his hostel room. He had just returned from a summer break. Police suspect suicide and are investigating a possible family issue. The institute has formed a panel to investigate. This marks the fourth unnatural death at IIT-Kharagpur in recent months.
title: IIT-Kharagpur student found dead in hostel; 4th in 7 months

author: DHANANJAY.MAHAPATRA
description: Lalu Prasad faces setback as Supreme Court refuses to halt trial in land-for-job scam. CBI alleges Prasad secured land for railway jobs during his tenure as minister. Kapil Sibal argued political vendetta, but court allows trial to proceed. Court directs trial court to dispense with Prasad's presence. CBI filed chargesheet against Prasad, Rabri Devi, Tej Pratap Yadav, and Hema Yadav.
title: In blow to Lalu, SC refuses to stay trials in land-for jobs cases

author: HARVEER DABAS
description: A power outage in a UP village miraculously saved 50 children after their school bus crashed into an electricity pole submerged in a water-filled ditch. While three children sustained injuries, potential electrocution was averted due to the outage. In a separate incident in the same district, a teacher and student died when an earth-moving vehicle collided with a school van.
title: Power outage turns life-saver for 50 kids on school bus

author: TNN
description: Rahul Gandhi defended Robert Vadra against ED's chargesheet, denouncing it as a politically motivated witch-hunt by the BJP government. Congress launched a full-fledged defense, asserting Vadra's innocence and highlighting the absence of illegality in the land deal. A Delhi court has taken up the money laundering chargesheet against Vadra and others, scheduling it for document verification and consideration in July.
title: Rahul Gandhi defends Robert Vadra against ED charges, Congress follows suit

author: MOHD DILSHAD
title: Serial sex offender, 55, shot dead in UP encounter

author: SANDEEP RAI
description: Naresh Kumar was arrested in Meerut for allegedly killing a community dog. He repeatedly slammed the dog onto a road in Sisoli. A video of the incident surfaced, sparking outrage. Sonia Gautam from Sarayu Animal Welfare Society filed a complaint. The FIR was registered at Mundali police station. Police are investigating previous similar crimes by the accused.
title: UP man held for killing dog by slamming it on road

author: SHILPA PHADNIS
description: Delhi High Court instructed Wipro to pay Rupees Two Lakh to an ex-employee. This was due to defamatory comments in the relieving letter. The court ordered Wipro to issue a new letter without the damaging statements. The original letter contained malicious remarks about the employee's conduct. The court emphasized that the remarks would harm the employee's career.
title: Wipro to pay 2 lakh to ex-staffer for ‘defamatory’ relieving letter

author: SANJAY KHAJURIA
title: Amarnath Yatra resumes after daylong suspension

author: SANJAY KHAJURIA
description: A special NIA court in Jammu has charged Nisar Ahmed and Mushtaq Hussain for aiding the 2023 Dhangri massacre perpetrators. Accused of providing shelter, food, and guidance to terrorists linked to Lashkar-e-Taiba, they face charges under IPC, UAPA, and Juvenile Justice Act. Both pleaded not guilty and sought trial after being accused of facilitating the attack that killed five villagers.
title: Dhangri massacre: NIA court frames charges against 2 terrorist harbourers

author: DIPAK K DASH
description: Union Home Secretary Govind Mohan emphasized the necessity for every city to appoint a Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) to safeguard data and systems against cyber threats. He urged states and city administrations to conduct regular security audits and build internal capacity for technology integration.
title: Every city must have chief information security officer, says home secretary

author: SANJAY KHAJURIA
title: J&K DGP reviews security situation in Valley; stresses ops in higher reaches

author: DIPAK K DASH
description: The road transport ministry will soon rank states based on their 'ease of land acquisition' for national highway projects, addressing a major cause of delays. This initiative aims to prioritize projects in states that efficiently provide land, potentially using past performance as a benchmark. The Centre's reliance on state governments for land acquisition underscores the importance of this ranking system.
title: Road ministry to rank states on land buy speed to fast-track NH projects

author: NASEER GANAI
description: In Qazigund, Srinagar, a man posing as a soldier entered a house under the guise of a search operation. When a family member grew suspicious and confronted him, the imposter stabbed him to death. The accused, Naseer Ahmad Sheikh, has been arrested, and an investigation is underway to uncover the full details of the crime and any potential accomplices.
title: Thief posing as soldier kills soon-to-be groom in Srinagar

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: In a first, Koneru Humpy, Dronavalli Harika, R Vaishali, and Divya Deshmukh made it to the FIDE Women’s World Cup quarterfinals. FIDE CEO Emil Sutovsky congratulated the players. The Indian players won tense tie-breakers. Humpy defeated Alexandra Kosteniuk, and Harika edged out Kateryna Lagno. Vaishali defeated Meruert Kamalidenova, and Divya Deshmukh beat Zhu Jiner.
title: 'Quite a feat' - FIDE CEO lauds Indians after all four enter QFs of women's WC

author: RASHMI DROLIA
title: Six Maoists killed in ongoing encounter in Chhattisgarh’s Abujhmarh

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Sonya Curry, mother of Stephen Curry, recently shared an emotional message on Instagram. She urged her followers to connect with their loved ones. Sonya emphasized the importance of spending quality time with family and friends. She encouraged fans to make an effort to visit and engage with people they care about. Sonya also launched a 'LOVE FIERCELY' challenge.
title: Sonya Curry shares heartfelt message, visits mother in hospital

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Chirag Paswan is again targeting Bihar CM Nitish Kumar, this time over the state's deteriorating law and order, raising concerns about rising crime. Despite being part of the NDA, Paswan's criticism mirrors opposition claims, fueling speculation of a repeat of his 2020 strategy, when he supported the BJP but opposed Nitish Kumar.
title: Bihar elections: Is BJP using Chirag Paswan to checkmate CM Nitish?

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: MNS chief Raj Thackeray retaliated against BJP MP Nishikant Dubey's threatening remark, daring him to visit Mumbai, escalating the language debate in Maharashtra. Thackeray warned of retaliation in Mumbai's waters, responding to Dubey's defense that Mumbai isn't exclusively for Marathis.
title: 'Dubo ke maarenge': Raj Thackeray counters BJP MP's 'patak ke maarenge' remark

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Farokh Engineer has voiced concerns about Karun Nair's form in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy, citing his inability to convert starts into significant scores. With Nair averaging just 21.83, pressure mounts ahead of the Manchester Test. Engineer emphasized the need for substantial runs from the No. 3 position.
title: IND vs ENG: Karun Nair lambasted after his poor displays in England - 'Beautiful 30 is not expected from a No. 3'

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: In Balasore, a B.Ed student's self-immolation case has taken a turn as her friend alleges the HoD threatened to fail her for not complying with demands. The friend also accused the Principal of provoking the victim, leading to her tragic death after a protest against the HoD.
title: Odisha's self-immolation case: Victim's friend says HoD threatened to fail her

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: Bihar rally: Men waive black flags at PM Modi during speech; 3 detained

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
title: Coldplay, kiss cams and cloud data: What does Astronomer actually do?

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: 'Incident' at LA Sheriff County training facility: 3 killed; Pam Bondi calls it ‘horrific’

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: 'India doesn't subscribe to unilateral sanctions': MEA on EU's move against Russia

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Indian batter Pratika Rawal addressed the controversy surrounding her shoulder contact with England players during the first Women's ODI, stating it was unintentional. The ICC fined her 10 percent of her match fee and issued one demerit point.
title: 'It was not ...': India batter responds to shoulder contact controversy after ICC fine

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Donald Trump has questioned why Democrats didn't disclose Jeffrey Epstein-related files during their control of the Senate and White House, suggesting they had no incriminating evidence. This statement followed his instruction to Attorney General Pam Bondi to release relevant grand jury testimony in the Epstein case, amid pressure from both supporters and Democrats.
title: Trump questions why Dems didn't release Epstein files if it is 'smoking gun''

author: CHIDANAND RAJGHATTA
title: US tags TRF as terror group: Lashkar proxy nailed; Pakistan, China left red-faced

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: OpenAI is developing ChatGPT Agents, an AI tool functioning as a virtual computer to automate digital tasks. Yash Kumar, an IIIT Hyderabad alumnus and former Google engineer, leads the project. The system manages calendars, summarizes meetings, and plans meals, seeking user confirmation for critical actions and incorporating security safeguards for safe operation.
title: Who is Yash Kumar, the project lead of OpenAI’s ChatGPT Agent- What is this?

author: VINOBHA K T
description: Mangaluru police apprehended Roshan Saldana, accused of swindling crores from businessmen by posing as a wealthy entrepreneur. Saldana promised large loans, collected stamp duty and commissions, and then defrauded his victims. Police seized incriminating documents, jewelry, and excessive liquor from his residence, also revealing ₹40 crore in transactions over recent months.
title: Diamond, booze, bogus deals: How conman duped big shots; Rs 2.75 cr ring, luxury liquor seized

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Brian Lara has unveiled his 'Greatest of All Time' selections, featuring Jasprit Bumrah alongside legends like Glenn McGrath, Jacques Kallis, and Adam Gilchrist. He also named Rohit Sharma, Chris Gayle, Shaheen Shah Afridi, Kane Williamson, and Kevin Pietersen in his 'legend' category.
title: For Brian Lara, Jasprit Bumrah is the 'GOAT'! Rohit Sharma is...

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: India faces England in the crucial fourth Test at Old Trafford, seeking to level the series after their Lord's defeat. Rishabh Pant, cleared to play despite a finger injury, is close to surpassing Rohit Sharma's WTC run record for India, needing just 40 runs. India's hopes hinge on Pant's performance as they aim to keep the series alive.
title: IND vs ENG: Rohit's WTC record in danger! Pant closes in on massive feat

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: The Edmonton Oilers are reportedly exploring a major trade move this offseason. NHL insiders link them to Nashville Predators forward Jonathan Marchessault, who carries a $27.5 million deal. With Stanley Cup pressure building and a need for top-six scoring, Edmonton could see Marchessault as a high-risk, high-reward acquisition, if contract hurdles and fit can be managed.
title: Oilers eye $27M Marchessault — veteran scoring boost targeted

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Khushi Kapoor shared her views on cosmetic surgery. Aamir Khan spoke about his bond with his ex-wives, Reena Dutta and Kiran Rao. Mohit Suri recalled approaching Amrita Singh for a role. Kiara Advani and Sidharth Malhotra took their newborn home. A viral statement followed a Coldplay concert involving Astronomer CEO Andy Byron. The statement was later confirmed to be fake.
title: Read: Top 5 entertainment news

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: RIL Q1 results FY 2025-26: Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries posted a Profit After Tax (PAT) of Rs 26,994 crore beating Street estimates. The net profit rose 78% from Rs 15,138 crore a year ago.
title: Reliance Industries posts net profit of Rs 26,994 crore; up 78% YOY

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Nishikant Dubey defended his controversial "tumko patak patak ke marenge" remark, asserting that Mumbai belongs to all, not just Marathi speakers. He criticized the targeting of Hindi speakers and questioned the selective outrage, pointing out the diverse linguistic makeup of Mumbai. Dubey warned Uddhav and Raj Thackeray that they would face consequences outside Maharashtra for their divisive actions.
title: 'Why attack Hindi speakers?' Nishikant defends 'patak ke marenge' remarks

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: China's economic growth masks a debt crisis. Many citizens face financial strain. They struggle with job insecurity and wage cuts. Some turn to side hustles for survival. A few share their debt stories online. The government offers subsidies. However, consumer sentiment remains low. Structural reforms are slow. The Chinese dream faces challenges. People prioritize survival over spending.
title: Why millions in China feel trapped and alone - despite a ‘strong’ economy

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Following the Air India Flight AI-171 crash in Ahmedabad, Tata Group has established 'The AI-171 Memorial and Welfare Trust' with a corpus of Rs 500 crore. The trust aims to support the victims' families and those affected by the tragedy.
title: Air India crash: Tata Group launches Rs 500 crore trust for victims’ families

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Following a viral Kiss Cam moment at a Coldplay concert, Astronomer's CEO, Andy Byron, and Chief of Human Resources, Kristin Cabot, were caught in a compromising position, sparking affair rumors. The Seattle Mariners then playfully capitalized on the situation with a meme featuring Cal Raleigh, inviting those in similar situations to contact them, further fueling the internet frenzy.
title: Coldplay Kiss Cam scandal: Mariners mock Astronomer CEO Andy Byron

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: The EU has intensified sanctions against Russia, targeting oil revenues and military capabilities due to the Ukraine conflict. These measures impact a Rosneft-owned Indian refinery and lower the oil price ceiling, potentially benefiting India through cheaper crude.
title: EU imposes sanctions on Rosneft's India refinery - how it may benefit India

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: Fauja Singh case: 'Driver wasn't an enemy,' says son; 'could have shown humanity'

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: KL Rahul is close to joining an elite group of Indian cricketers, needing just 11 more runs to reach 1,000 Test runs in England. He aims to achieve this milestone in the upcoming fourth Test against England in Manchester.
title: IND vs ENG: After Sachin, Gavaskar and Dravid, KL Rahul 11 runs away from...

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Following a narrow defeat at Lord's, Shubman Gill and the Indian team have arrived in Manchester for a crucial fourth Test against England, starting July 23. With England leading the series 2-1, India faces a must-win situation. Preparations include optional and full training sessions, with media interactions scheduled to address the pressure and strategies for a comeback.
title: IND vs ENG: When will India begin preparations in Manchester for 4th Test?

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: BJP MP Nishikant Dubey emphasized PM Modi's crucial role in the party's electoral triumphs, asserting that without PM Modi's leadership, the BJP might struggle to secure even 150 seats. He highlighted how PM Modi's popularity has drawn in previously unsupportive voter segments, particularly among the poor.
title: 'Majboori hai': MP claims BJP may not win 150 seats without PM Modi

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Sidney Crosby's future with the Pittsburgh Penguins is uncertain amidst rebuild speculation and Evgeni Malkin's potential departure. Trade rumors link Crosby to the Montreal Canadiens and Colorado Avalanche, fueled by his friendship with Nathan MacKinnon and ties to Montreal. Despite the buzz, Crosby remains focused, but his long-term security in Pittsburgh is questioned.
title: Sidney Crosby trade buzz grows — Canadiens & Avalanche emerge top suitors — Penguins insist he stays

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi criticized the Trinamool Congress (TMC) in Durgapur, accusing them of jeopardizing West Bengal's identity by encouraging infiltration, which he views as a threat to both the state and the nation. He pledged action against illegal immigrants while highlighting the BJP's commitment to Bengali pride and development. Modi also inaugurated development projects worth ₹5,400 crore.
title: 'TMC facilitates infiltrators': PM Modi slams Mamata govt- Top quotes

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Donald Trump has escalated his criticism of Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, accusing him of stalling the housing market with high interest rates. Trump hinted at a possible dismissal over a controversial $2.5 billion renovation at the Fed's headquarters, branding Powell a "numbskull.
title: Trump targets Fed Chair again, calls on 'too late, numbskull’ to lower rates

author: NIRMALYA DUTTA
description: The Extrapolation Bias: A meta-bias where one’s brain takes one bit of data and decides to use it explain everything. It’s the Captain Planet of cognitive distortions – summoned when Confirmation Bias, Availability Heuristic, the Baader-Meinhof Effect, Illusory Correlation and Narrative Bias join forces. It’s the mind’s lazy cognitive shortcut where one instance becomes an example of a pattern and ergo proof of how society is functioning. You're not analysing — you're projecting, pattern-hunting, and storytelling your way into a worldview that feels right, even if it has no resemblance to reality.
title: Why new Superman movie isn't 'anti-Israel'

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Dell Technologies is grappling with internal dissatisfaction, as revealed by its annual 'Tell Dell' survey. A significant drop in employee net promoter score (eNPS) indicates declining workplace sentiment. Factors contributing to this include return-to-office mandates, ongoing layoffs, AI-driven restructuring fatigue, and a perceived loss of trust and job security, despite the company's financial growth and AI advancements.
title: HR at Dell: Chief shares ‘Tell Dell’ details with staff

author: TOI LIFESTYLE DESK
description: Astronomer CEO Andy Byron's public embrace with his Chief People Officer at a Coldplay concert ignited a scandal, raising questions about workplace ethics and his marriage. Byron's wife, Megan Kerrigan, responded by removing his surname from social media, hinting at marital strain. The incident sparked widespread online reactions, with many supporting Kerrigan amidst affair rumors.
title: Coldplay ‘kiss cam’ scandal: Who is Andy Byron’s wife Megan Kerrigan?

author: SAHIL MALHOTRA
description: India have had steady options in Rahul Dravid and Cheteshwar Pujara in the No. 3 spot over the years. That all-important role is in limbo during this transition period. In the three Tests in England, Sai Sudharsan and Karun Nair have held the roles but not made it their own - just yet.
title: From Rahul Dravid to Cheteshwar Pujara to who now? India's No. 3 question remains unanswered

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: The Toronto Maple Leafs continue to stir NHL headlines following Mitch Marner’s trade to the Vegas Golden Knights. With offensive gaps to fill, speculation is mounting around a potential blockbuster deal. General manager Brad Treliving has made several smaller moves, but could be plotting a bigger swing as Toronto looks to remain competitive in the National Hockey League.
title: Leafs eye bigger trade splash after Marner exit rocks NHL offseason

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: PM Narendra Modi criticized the Trinamool Congress government. He accused them of fostering lawlessness and loot in West Bengal. Modi claimed people are turning to the BJP for hope. He highlighted the lack of job opportunities. Modi promised economic transformation if the BJP wins. He questioned the state's investment environment citing violence and bias.
title: 'Lies and loot': PM attacks Mamata govt; says Bengal youth forced to migrate

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Gary Kirsten revealed Yuvraj Singh's selection for the 2011 World Cup team wasn't guaranteed, with Kirsten and MS Dhoni advocating for his inclusion due to his experience. Despite a quiet 2010, Yuvraj delivered a stellar performance, scoring 362 runs and taking 15 wickets. His crucial contributions helped India win the tournament, earning him the Player of the Tournament award.
title: 'MS Dhoni and I were ...': Yuvraj nearly missed 2011 WC; Kirsten opens up

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: 'Nothing formal can happen right now': Centre to SC on nurse execution case

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: American gymnast Suni Lee clarified that she is not dating New York Knicks star OG Anunoby. Rumors began after Lee attended the East Conference Finals. She stated that their interactions were misinterpreted by social media. Lee mentioned she is friends with several Knicks players, including Karl-Anthony Towns. She enjoys watching basketball and that is why she attended the games.
title: Suni Lee shuts down OG Anunoby romance talk: ‘We’re just friends’

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Former England captain Paul Ince has been handed a ban for being caught driving over the legal alcohol limit in Cheshire. The incident occurred on June 28. A police officer witnessed Ince's car swerving. The ex-Liverpool, Manchester United player admitted to having consumed two drinks before driving.
title: 12 month ban, Rs 8.20 lakh fine! Ex-England star penalised for drink-driving

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Ring founder Jamie Siminoff mandates AI usage demonstration for employee promotions within the RBKS organization, including Ring, Blink, and Key. This initiative aims to foster innovation, efficiency, and align with Amazon's broader focus on AI-driven productivity. Employees must showcase AI's impact on customer experience and operational improvements to advance their careers.
title: Amazon sets new requirements for employee promotions in 'these' departments

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: The Coldplay concert 'kiss cam' incident involving Astronomer CEO Andy Byron and Chief People Officer Kristin Cabot has spiraled into a major controversy. A man claiming to be Byron's childhood acquaintance accused him of bullying. The scandal intensified after Byron's wife reportedly removed 'Byron' from her Facebook name, sparking widespread online support for her amidst the infidelity allegations.
title: Coldplay scandal: Astronomer CEO's senior says 'hasn’t learned his lesson'

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Get ready for a pawsome spectacle! On August 2, 2025, Linda Mar Beach in Pacifica, California, will host the World Dog Surfing Championships. Dogs of all sizes will compete for the Golden Surfie Award, showcasing their wave-riding skills. The event features a dog fashion show, rescue dog adoptions, and charity activities, promising a fun-filled day for all.
title: Dogs hit the waves: Canines gear up for World Dog Surfing Championships — California beach to host

author: JYOTIRMOY HALDER
description: Divyanshi Bhowmick, a 14-year-old table tennis prodigy, recently made history by winning the U-15 girls’ singles crown at the Asian Youth Table Tennis Championships after 36 years. Despite her remarkable achievements and world ranking, she faces a different kind of challenge: the upcoming Class 10 board exams. She is 'really scared' of it.
title: Exclusive | Divyanshi, first Indian in 36 years to win historic gold, 'really scared' of a school challenge

author: YUDHVIR RANA
description: Shubham Dubey, a software engineer, has been detained by Amritsar Police for allegedly sending threatening emails to the SGPC, warning of a bomb attack on the Golden Temple. The emails, received over three days, claimed planned explosive attacks at Sri Harmandir Sahib.
title: Golden Temple threat mails: Techie detained; devices seized for probe

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Ben Stokes' high workload in the Test series has reignited the debate over player management, contrasting with India's cautious approach with Jasprit Bumrah. While Stokes bowls long spells despite injury risks, Bumrah's workload is carefully managed to preserve him for future matches. Critics question if India's strategy is too restrictive, especially in crucial moments, as the series intensifies.
title: How overworked are Indian bowlers even as Stokes bowls 100-plus overs

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Following Rahul Gandhi's claim that Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma would face jail time for alleged corruption, Sarma responded sharply, asserting his Assamese identity and dismissing Gandhi's remarks as detached from reality. Sarma linked Gandhi's visit to violent clashes during an eviction drive in Goalpara, accusing him of encouraging encroachment.
title: 'Joke is on him': Himanta reacts to Rahul's 'jail' remark; shows 'thenga'

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: As India gear up for the crucial fourth Test against England, the participation of ace pacer Jasprit Bumrah remains uncertain. Former coach Anil Kumble strongly advocates for Bumrah's inclusion, emphasizing the must-win nature of the match. Assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate hints at leaning towards playing Bumrah, acknowledging the series is at stake.
title: Ex-India coach makes honest Bumrah admission: 'If he wants rest, he doesn't need to ...'

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: Govt not involved in Justice Varma impeachment move: Law minister Meghwal

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Lloyd Howell Jr. abruptly resigned as NFL Players Association executive director amidst controversy. His ties to The Carlyle Group, a private equity firm with NFL ownership connections, and a confidentiality agreement with the league raised trust issues. Additionally, his involvement with OneTeam Partners, under federal investigation, and a past sexual discrimination lawsuit further fueled internal discontent, leading to his departure.
title: Howell Jr. steps down as NFLPA chief: Conflict of interest, sealed rulings spark outrage

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Monty Panesar urges India to unleash Jasprit Bumrah in the crucial fourth Test against England, emphasising its "must-win" importance. He questions Arshdeep Singh's exclusion, highlighting his potential impact with left-arm seam. While Bumrah's workload is a concern, Team India leans towards playing him in Manchester, but Arshdeep's hand injury adds selection uncertainty.
title: IND vs ENG: 'He has to play' - Ex-Eng cricketer bats for Bumrah in must-win 4th Test

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The Indian navy has commissioned INS Nistar, a diving support vessel. It happened at Visakhapatnam naval dockyard. Hindustan shipyard limited built the vessel. INS Nistar can handle deep-sea diving and rescue operations. The vessel can also act as a mother ship for the navy’s deep submergence rescue vessel. The ship's components are mostly indigenous.
title: INS Nistar commissioned: India's first indigenous deep-sea rescue ship; joins elite global club

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Following the brazen daylight execution of a murder convict inside Patna's Paras Hospital, new footage has emerged showing the suspected killers celebrating their act openly on the streets, brandishing a firearm. The incident, captured on CCTV, has ignited outrage over Bihar's deteriorating law and order situation, prompting political accusations and demands for stricter governance.
title: Patna hospital murder: New footage shows gunmen celebrating on street

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Goldman Sachs is launching a new program to retain junior bankers amid increasing competition from private equity firms. The initiative offers select analysts an accelerated path to the Asset & Wealth Management (AWM) division after two years in investment banking. This strategy aims to provide an 'early entry point' for those interested in buyside careers.
title: Sachs plans to keep junior talent; memo for those interested in bayside careers

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: The EU has intensified sanctions against Russia, targeting oil revenues with a reduced price cap of $45 per barrel and banning dealings related to the Nord Stream gas pipelines. These measures aim to constrict Russia's financial capabilities and limit its ability to fund the war in Ukraine.
title: Sanctions on Russia: EU unveils strong measures; oil cap lowered, shadow fleet hit

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Meta has apologized to Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah after its Kannada translation tool made a serious error. The tool inaccurately translated a condolence message about actress B Sarojadevi's death. The translation error caused public outrage. Siddaramaiah criticized Meta for the faulty translation. He also warned citizens about translation inaccuracies.
title: Siddaramaiah 'death' post: Meta apologises for Kannada post blunder

author: TOI SCIENCE DESK
description: Get ready for a celestial spectacle. On August 2, 2027, a total solar eclipse will grace Europe, North Africa, and the Middle East. The Moon will completely block the Sun for up to six minutes. This event is the longest total solar eclipse visible from land in over a century. Prime viewing spots include Libya and Egypt.
title: Solar Eclipse 2025: 6 minutes of total darkness- when and where to watch

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: T.J. Watt, the star defensive player, has signed a massive 3-year contract extension with the Pittsburgh Steelers. The deal makes him the highest-paid non-quarterback in NFL history with career earnings crossing $255 million. His brother, J.J. Watt, reacted with pride and humor. This move is crucial for the Steelers as they aim for a resurgence.
title: T.J. Watt signs extension with Pittsburgh Steelers- brother reacts hilariously;

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Hasin Jahan, the estranged wife of Mohammed Shami, and her daughter Arshi Jahan are facing serious charges, including attempted murder, after a violent clash with a neighbour, Dalia Khatoon, in Suri, West Bengal. The dispute arose over a contested plot of land, leading to a physical altercation that resulted in Dalia's hospitalisation and a police investigation following the viral video.
title: Watch | FIR filed against Shami's estranged wife; video of scuffle goes viral

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: Maharashtra MLA Rohit Pawar confronted a police officer at Mumbai’s Azad Maidan police station following confusion over the whereabouts of an injured party worker, Nitin Deshmukh. Pawar and NCP (SP) MLA Jitendra Awhad were searching for Deshmukh, allegedly assaulted by BJP MLC Gopichand Padalkar's supporters. A video shows Pawar visibly angry, accusing the police of being unhelpful and evasive.
title: Watch: Day after assembly brawl, MLA Rohit Pawar loses cool at Mumbai police station

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: The Indian Army's future frontline weapon, the AK-203 assault rifle, will be fully indigenous by the end of 2025, according to IRRPL CEO Major General SK Sharma. Over 6 lakh rifles have been ordered, with 48,000 already delivered. Production is ramping up at the Korwa facility, aiming for complete order fulfillment by 2030, ahead of schedule.
title: Amethi's IRRPL to complete delivery of AK-203 rifles soon

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Astronomer CEO Andy Byron and HR head Kristin Cabot are allegedly involved in a cheating affair, exposed by a kiss-cam at a Coldplay concert. A statement, purportedly from Byron, confessing to the affair and apologizing to his wife and Astronomer team, has gone viral.
title: 'I apologize to my wife': Astronomer CEO Byron's after viral Coldplay moment

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: India opener Pratika Rawal faced a fine of 10% of her match fee for inappropriate physical contact during the first ODI against England, breaching the ICC Code of Conduct twice. Additionally, she received a demerit point. England's team was also penalised, incurring a five percent fine for a slow over rate.
title: IND vs ENG: 'Avoidable shoulder bump' - India batter fined; England team penalised

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: India's Defence Ministry is reportedly pushing for a collaboration with France to develop next-generation fighter jet engines, aiming for self-reliance in this critical technology. The ₹61,000 crore initiative seeks to create a 120kn engine for future platforms like the AMCA.
title: India and France: Govt pitches Rs 61,000 cr deal for next gen fighter engine

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Apple has filed a lawsuit against Jon Prosser and Michael Ramacciotti, accusing them of stealing iOS 26 trade secrets. Ramacciotti allegedly accessed a development iPhone belonging to an Apple employee, and then showed the unreleased software to Prosser via FaceTime. Prosser then used the footage to create content for his YouTube channel, generating revenue from Apple's confidential information.
title: iOS 26 leak: Apple sues YouTuber for planting 'spy' at employee's house

author: TOI Education
description: Kerala DHSE announced the Plus Two SAY (Save A Year) Result 2025 on July 18, offering a second chance to students who didn't pass the regular exams. Over 80,000 students participated in the supplementary exams held from June 23 to 27. Candidates can check their results on keralaresults.nic.in, results.hse.kerala.gov.in, or result.kite.kerala.gov.in using their roll number and date of birth.
title: Kerala plus two SAY result 2025 declared: Direct link to check - here

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: MNS chief Raj Thackeray criticized the recent violence in the Maharashtra Assembly, decrying the decline in political decorum and demanding accountability. He questioned the obsession with power and the silence of critics who usually target MNS workers. Thackeray also warned against wasting public funds on such incidents and the potential for future escalation, urging impartial action from the state government.
title: 'Tried to belittle Marathi': Raj Thackeray slams assembly brawl; defends MNS 'soldiers'

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: A major scandal has erupted in Thailand involving Wilawan Emsawat, accused of blackmailing senior Buddhist monks through romantic relationships and extorting temple funds. Her actions led to the disrobing of several clergy members and exposed financial irregularities within religious institutions.
title: Who is Wilawan Emsawat? The woman at the centre of Thailand’s monk scandal

author: PATHIKRIT CHAKRABORTY
description: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) conducted searches at 14 locations linked to Chhangur Baba, the alleged mastermind of a religious conversion syndicate, following a PMLA case. These searches, spanning Balrampur and Mumbai, uncovered a suspected Rs 100-crore foreign funding racket. Investigations revealed suspicious transactions, foreign remittances, and illegal land deals potentially financing mass religious conversions.
title: Conversion racket: ED raids Chhangur Baba’s network in UP, Mumbai

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: A recent SpiceJet flight witnessed a tense situation as passengers demanded the air-conditioning be switched on before takeoff. A viral video captured distressed travelers expressing their anger, with some requesting the flight be halted due to the sweltering cabin conditions.
title: 'Bekaar hai': Chaos as AC fails on Spicejet flight - watch

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Following a loss at Lord's, the Indian team maintained a positive atmosphere during training session in Beckenham, ahead of the fourth Test in Manchester, starting July 23. Rishabh Pant's finger injury raises concerns about his role, with former head coach Ravi Shastri emphasising he should only play if he can keep wickets.
title: IND vs ENG: 'Aaj Duggal ji behre hain' - Bumrah, Pant banter lights up India's prep

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: ITR filing FY 2024-25: The Income Tax Department has enabled online ITR-2 filing for FY 2024-25, allowing taxpayers with salary, capital gains, and cryptocurrency income to file returns by September 15, 2025. Significant changes to ITR-2 include segregated capital gains reporting, permissible capital losses on share buybacks, increased asset disclosure threshold, and detailed deduction information.
title: ITR-2 filing FY 2024-25: Now live on Income Tax portal; check details

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, during his visit to East Champaran, lauded Operation Sindoor's success and contrasted his government's development initiatives with the previous RJD era, accusing them of neglecting Bihar. He inaugurated projects worth over ₹7,200 crore and flagged off Amrit Bharat trains.
title: PM Modi says 'took resolve of Op Sindoor from Bihar'; takes jibe at Lalu - top quotes

author: AVISHEK KUMAR
description: Hindu Raksha Dal members protested outside a KFC in Ghaziabad, demanding it stop serving non-vegetarian food during the Kanwar Yatra. Protesters shouted religious slogans, forced the outlet to close, and insisted on vegetarian-only service during Shravan. Police have registered an FIR against unidentified individuals for violating public order and disobeying regulations.
title: 'Veg items only': Hindu Raksha Dal protests at Ghaziabad KFC

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: USCIS criticized the U visa program, intended to protect alien crime victims, alleging mismanagement and exploitation by fraudsters, criminal aliens, and corrupt law enforcement. Under the Trump administration, measures were taken to combat U visa-related fraud. USCIS uncovered inconsistencies in applications involving several law enforcement officials, highlighting the program's vulnerabilities.
title: What is America’s U Visa: ‘Great idea gone wrong,’ says US immigration authority

author: AMISHA RAJANI
description: American universities anticipate a significant drop in Indian students this fall due to visa appointment freezes and increased rejection rates. Students are facing uncertainty and exploring alternative countries like Germany as visa slots remain scarce. The US Consulate General in Hyderabad assures that slots have resumed, but heightened scrutiny is causing anxiety and application withdrawals.
title: Visa crisis: US universities could see 70% drop in Indian students this fall; here's why

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Mitchell Starc celebrated his 100th Test with a remarkable 6 for 9 against the West Indies, prompting Ricky Ponting to recall the moment he recognised Starc's potential. Ponting remembers a young Starc troubling Sachin Tendulkar with pace and bounce, signaling his extraordinary talent. Starc's commitment to prioritising Test cricket over IPL has solidified his legacy as an Australian great.
title: Cricket | 'Someone like Tendulkar ...': When Ponting knew Starc was special

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: In Delhi's Tilak Nagar, Deepak Sharma, a social media influencer, was attacked. The assault occurred due to a disagreement related to social media content. Pradeep Dhaka and his associates are identified as the attackers. Police have filed a case and are searching for the accused. Both Sharma and Dhaka are reportedly social media influencers.
title: Delhi road rumble: Feud among social media influencers turns ugly

author: KRISHNA CHAUDHARY
description: Manisha, a 28-year-old woman, died in Baghpat. She consumed poison. Her family alleges dowry harassment by her husband Kundan Kumar and in-laws. Manisha left a suicide note on her body. It accused her husband and in-laws. The couple married in November 2023. Baghpat police are investigating the case as a dowry death. The investigation is underway.
title: Harassed by in-laws, UP woman writes note on hands, legs & kills herself

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: As Team India prepares for a crucial Test against England, Rishabh Pant's injured finger is a major concern. Ravi Shastri insists Pant should only play if fit to keep wickets, while assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate remains optimistic about his recovery. Pant's participation hinges on his ability to both bat and keep effectively, with Dhruv Jurel as a potential replacement.
title: IND vs ENG: Shastri delivers damning verdict on Pant - 'He shouldn't play if ...'

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: Liquor scam: ED arrests ex-Chhattisgarh CM Baghel’s son; action follows raid at residence

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: Following a heated argument, supporters of BJP MLA Gopichand Padalkar and NCP leader Jitendra Awhad clashed outside the Maharashtra Assembly, leading to the registration of an FIR and two arrests. A video of the scuffle inside the Vidhan Bhavan, near the main staircase and lobby, went viral, showing both groups exchanging blows.
title: Maharashtra assembly brawl: 2 arrested after BJP-NCP (SP) supporters indulge in fist fight

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: The US has informed the WTO that India's retaliatory tariffs on American automobiles, steel, and aluminium lack a legal basis, despite India's claim of significant export impact and duty collections. This dispute unfolds as both nations engage in trade deal negotiations, with the US asserting its tariffs are protected under national security provisions.
title: ‘No legal basis’: US says India has no grounds for retaliatory tariffs

author: TNN
description: A private college in Harda faced backlash for advertising chickens, listing one breed as 'Narmada,' a name sacred to the Narmadiya Brahmin Samaj. The community protested, deeming it an insult to their religious beliefs and the revered Narmada River.
title: MP college brands chicken breed 'Narmada', sparks row

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Rahul Gandhi has strongly defended Robert Vadra against money laundering charges, dismissing the ED's chargesheet as a decade-long politically motivated witch hunt. The ED accuses Vadra of laundering proceeds from a Gurgaon land deal, leading to the attachment of his properties. Vadra's office has refuted the charges, asserting his cooperation and confidence in clearing his name through legal proceedings.
title: 'Hounded by govt for last 10 yrs': Rahul backs Vadra; calls ED chargesheet 'witch hunt'

author: ARANI BASU
description: India face bowling concerns as Arshdeep Singh's hand injury adds to Bumrah's workload management issues ahead of the crucial Manchester Test. The team management is considering playing Bumrah, despite his limited availability, while assessing Rishabh Pant's fitness to keep wickets. Mohammed Siraj's role becomes vital, and the team must carefully manage his workload to ensure he remains effective.
title: IND vs ENG: 'Got to look at all factors' - India may be forced to play Bumrah in Manchester

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: At the Open Championship, Jon Rahm faced a tense moment. A spectator's whistle disturbed his shot on the 11th hole. Rahm expressed his frustration openly. He later acknowledged his overreaction. Despite the incident and subsequent bogeys, Rahm recovered. He finished the round at one-under-par. The incident highlights the mental challenges of professional golf.
title: Jon Rahm snaps at fan as pressure mounts at Open's toughest stage

author: RAJAT PANDIT
description: India has test-fired its nuclear-capable Prithvi-2 and Agni-1 ballistic missiles, sending a strategic message to Pakistan following recent border tensions. The tests, conducted by the strategic forces command, validated the operational and technical parameters of these Pakistan-specific missiles. These routine trials occur as India enhances its nuclear deterrence capabilities, with plans to induct the advanced Agni-Prime missile.
title: Message to Pak: India tests nuclear-capable Agni-1 & Prithvi-2 ballistic missiles

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The Supreme Court has refused to halt trial court proceedings against Lalu Prasad Yadav in the CBI's land-for-jobs case. Yadav's appeal followed the Delhi High Court's refusal to stay proceedings and issuance of notice to the CBI.
title: No relief for Lalu Yadav in 'Land-for-jobs' case: SC refuses to stay plea

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to inaugurate four new Amrit Bharat Express trains in Bihar, significantly boosting rail infrastructure and regional connectivity. The launch, part of a larger development project worth over Rs 7,200 crore, aims to provide affordable and comfortable travel, especially in eastern India.
title: Patna-Delhi Amrit Bharat: PM Modi to launch new Bihar route today; check details

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Reliance Industries' shares are experiencing a significant rally this year, outperforming the Nifty50 and adding $40 billion to its market capitalization. Analysts predict continued growth driven by improved refining margins and strong performance in telecommunications and retail.
title: RIL share price: Ambani-led co adds $40bn in m-cap; best rally over Nifty50 in 5 yrs

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: CBS will discontinue 'The Late Show with Stephen Colbert' by May 2026, citing financial challenges despite its high ratings. This decision follows a legal settlement between Paramount and Donald Trump, fueling speculation about political motivations behind the cancellation, especially given Colbert's criticism of Trump. Colbert acknowledged the show's end, expressing gratitude to CBS and his audience.
title: The 'Late' Show: End of an era as CBS cancels Stephen Colbert's popular show

author: TOI LIFESTYLE DESK
description: According to Dr. Saurabh Sethi, incorporating specific nuts at optimal times can significantly boost health. Almonds in the morning enhance metabolic health and mental clarity, while mid-morning pine nuts aid in appetite control. Cashews at lunchtime boost immunity and energy. Pistachios in the afternoon prevent energy slumps, and evening walnuts promote better sleep.
title: What is the best time to eat nuts for gut health - read here

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Astronomer's CEO, Andy Byron, and Chief People Officer, Kristin Cabot, are embroiled in controversy after a viral "kiss cam" moment at a Coldplay concert fueled affair allegations. The incident triggered a social media firestorm, prompting scrutiny of the company's culture and leadership. Amidst silence from Astronomer, former employees have criticized Byron's leadership, further escalating the reputational crisis.
title: 'Affair or just shy?': Chris Martin puts Astronomer CEO & his HR in awkward spot - Watch

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: Bengaluru was thrown into a state of alarm on Friday morning as approximately 40 private schools received bomb threats via email, prompting immediate responses from bomb disposal squads and police. Following similar threats in Delhi, authorities initiated thorough checks and precautionary evacuations to ensure the safety of students and staff.
title: Bengaluru bomb scare: 40 private schools receive threat mails; alert sounded

author: DHANANJAY MAHAPATRA
description: Justice Yashwant Varma of Allahabad High Court has petitioned the Supreme Court, contesting an inquiry report and a recommendation for impeachment proceedings against him. He claims the inquiry committee denied him a fair chance to respond before issuing its findings. The plea precedes Parliament's monsoon session, starting July 21.
title: Cash row: Ahead of removal motion in Parl, Justice Varma moves SC; challenges inquiry report findings

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Chelsea's Cole Palmer revealed that US President Donald Trump told him his son is a huge fan during the FIFA Club World Cup final trophy presentation. Palmer received the tournament's best player award from Trump after Chelsea's 3-0 victory over Paris Saint-Germain.
title: Football: Palmer reveals what Trump told him on stage after FIFA CWC win

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices exhibit resilience around key support levels, currently trading near ₹97,480. A cautiously optimistic tone prevails, bolstered by a bounce from critical moving averages. Technical indicators suggest stabilization, favoring a buy-on-dip strategy near ₹97,350 with a stop-loss at ₹96,800, targeting ₹97,800 and ₹98,200 if global sentiment remains supportive, says Jateen Trivedi, VP Research Analyst - Commodity and Currency, LKP Securities:
title: Gold price prediction: What's the gold rate outlook for today

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Despite India's narrow defeat in the Lord's Test, head coach Gautam Gambhir lauded Ravindra Jadeja's resilient performance. Chasing 193, Jadeja's unbeaten 61 nearly secured a miraculous victory. His grit under pressure drew praise from captain Shubman Gill and teammates, highlighting his valuable all-round skills.
title: IND vs ENG: 'An incredible fight' - Gambhir hails Jadeja's heroics after Lord's thriller

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Ajinkya Rahane urges India to prioritise taking 20 wickets for Test victories, highlighting the team's batting-heavy strategy's shortcomings after a narrow loss at Lord's. He emphasised the importance of bolstering the bowling attack for the crucial fourth Test in Manchester. Rahane also lauded Ben Stokes' pivotal fielding effort, identifying it as a turning point in the game.
title: IND vs ENG: 'You win by ...' - Rahane urges India to change XI for Manchester Test

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Vancouver Canucks are actively pursuing Jack Roslovic, a top free agent. This comes after a recent trade with Toronto Maple Leafs. Canucks aim to strengthen their team for a playoff push. Toronto also seeks to fill the gap left by Mitch Marner. They are considering Yegor Chinakhov. Canucks are exploring trade options if free agency doesn't work.
title: NHL trade twist: Canucks, Leafs battle off ice for prized free agent

author: RAUNAK BOSE
description: The Golden State Warriors are reportedly eyeing a trade for defensive standout Jonathan Isaac, alongside Jett Howard and Mo Gueye, in a three-team deal involving the Orlando Magic and Atlanta Hawks. This move aims to bolster the Warriors' defense and add size. Orlando would receive Moses Moody and Gui Santos, while Atlanta gains Goga Bitadze and a 2027 first-round pick.
title: Report: Warriors eye $86.6M Magic star in bold three‑team trade

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: The BCCI has announced record revenue of Rs 9,741.7 crore for FY 23-24, fuelled primarily by the IPL, which contributed 59% of total earnings. The IPL's success provides opportunities for players and ensures profitability, while the BCCI explores commercialising traditional formats and leveraging its substantial reserves. International cricket boards are also seeking collaboration, highlighting the BCCI's significant influence.
title: Sports Business: BCCI posts revenue of Rs 9,741.7 cr in FY 2023-24; IPL contributes 59 percent

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Ahead of PM Modi's Bihar visit, RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav mocked his arrival, attributing it to "electoral force." Tejashwi Yadav satirized Modi's itinerary, highlighting alleged hypocrisy. The visit, focused on launching development projects worth ₹7,200 crore, occurs amid crime concerns.
title: 'Would you like to hear lies?' Lalu's 'electoral force' jibe at PM Modi's Bihar visit

author: SAHIL MALHOTRA
description: Farokh Engineer, in Manchester, enjoyed watching a club cricket match with Dilip Vengsarkar and friends, reminiscing about his cricketing days. He fondly recalled hosting a barbecue for the Indian team in 1990, where a young Sachin Tendulkar was present before his first century. In an exclusive chat with TimesofIndia.com, he spoke about how times have changed in cricket culture.
title: An evening with Farokh Engineer: BBQ, Tendulkar's Old Trafford ton and the wait for Gavaskar

author: TOI Education
description: The Gujarat Secondary and Higher Secondary Education Board (GSEB) announced the Class 10 (SSC) Supplementary Exam Result 2025 on July 18. Students who appeared for the exams between June 23 and July 1 can now check their results on gseb.org, via WhatsApp, or SMS using their 6-digit seat number. Passing students can proceed to Class 11 admissions.
title: GSEB SSC supplementary result 2025 declared: Check direct link here

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: India face crucial decisions regarding Jasprit Bumrah and Rishabh Pant's fitness for the pivotal fourth Test against England, with the series at 2-1 in favour of the hosts. At the optional practice session, assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate provided an update on their fitness while also revealing another injury in the camp.
title: IND vs ENG: Are Jasprit Bumrah, Rishabh Pant fit for 4th Test? Injury concerns in squad

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: India's Test team is struggling in England, trailing 1-2 due to poor fielding. Dropped catches have been extremely costly, with a catching efficiency of just 60.90% compared to England's 78.30%. Missed opportunities in key moments have allowed England's batsmen to score crucial runs. Improving catching is essential for India to win the remaining Tests and salvage the series.
title: IND vs ENG: Drop Crisis! India's catching woes undermine Test campaign in England

author: RICHA PINTO
description: A chawl in Bandra East's Bharat Nagar collapsed early Friday, injuring at least seven and trapping several others. The second and third floors of the residential building gave way, prompting a Level-II emergency response. Rescue teams are working to free those still buried under the debris, with the injured being treated at Bhabha Hospital.
title: Mumbai chawl collapse: Floors cave in at 3-storey building; many feared trapped

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: The White House has refuted reports of a planned visit by President Trump to Pakistan in September. Trump is scheduled to visit Scotland from July 25-29, meeting with Prime Minister Starmer to advance trade discussions.
title: 'No trip scheduled': White House denies Trump's Pakistan trip; local media retracts report

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red on Friday. While Nifty50 was below 25,100, BSE Sensex was down over 100 points.
title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens in red; BSE Sensex down over 100 points

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar lauded the U.S. for designating The Resistance Front (TRF) as a Foreign Terrorist Organization and Specially Designated Global Terrorist. TRF, a Lashkar-e-Taiba proxy, claimed responsibility for the deadly Pahalgam attack in Jammu and Kashmir, which killed 26 civilians.
title: 'Zero tolerance for terror': India hails US move on Lashkar proxy TRF; EAM calls it strong coordination

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: Two schools in New Delhi, Abhinav Public School in Rohini Sector 3 and Richmondd Global School in Paschim Vihar, were targeted with bomb threats on Friday, prompting immediate responses from authorities.
title: Bomb scare: 20 Delhi schools receive threat emails; search under way

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Scottie Scheffler concluded the first day of the 2025 British Open at Royal Portrush just one stroke behind the leaders after a 3-under 68. Rory McIlroy showed composure with a 1-under round, a stark contrast to his previous outing at the same course. Bryson DeChambeau, along with other major stars, faces an uphill battle after a challenging start.
title: British open: Scottie Scheffler makes late push while Rory McIlroy stays close

author: RASHMI DROLIA
description: Enforcement Directorate officials conducted a search at the Bhilai residence of former Chief Minister and senior Congress leader Bhupesh Baghel on Friday morning. The ED team, accompanied by CRPF personnel, arrived in three cars. Baghel's office, through his X handle, alleged the action was intended to suppress the raising of the Tamnar tree cutting issue.
title: Chhattisgarh: ED raids former CM Bhupesh Baghel's Bhilai home

author: TOI LIFESTYLE DESK
description: Donald Trump has been diagnosed with chronic venous insufficiency (CVI) after experiencing mild swelling in his lower legs, according to the White House. Examinations revealed no evidence of deep vein thrombosis or arterial disease, and lab results were within normal limits. His physician noted no signs of heart failure, renal impairment, or systemic illness.
title: Donald Trump diagnosed with chronic venous insufficiency: How serious is it?

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: A video of Astronomer CEO Andy Byron and HR head Kristin Cabot kissing at a Coldplay concert has gone viral, sparking online chatter dubbed "Coldplaygate." The incident, captured on a kiss cam, led to speculation about workplace relationships. Elon Musk reacted to a morphed apology tweet with a laughing emoji, further fueling the controversy.
title: Musk’s reaction to Astronomer CEO apology’ after Coldplay ‘kiss cam’ scandal

author: TNN
description: Indian families sending money abroad for their children's education faced high bank fees. A report estimates they paid Rs 1,700 crore in 2024. Traditional banks charge high exchange rate markups. Digital remittances offer a cheaper alternative. India is now the largest source of international students in the US. Overseas education spending is expected to double by 2030.
title: Rs 1,700 crore: Hidden cost of sending money abroad

author: RAVINDRA UPPAR
description: Narayan Baramani, the police officer involved in a controversial incident with Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, has been appointed as DCP of Belagavi city. Baramani had sought voluntary retirement following the alleged 'slap gesture' during a Congress rally. He later withdrew his request after discussions with the CM and Home Minister.
title: Siddaramaiah slap gesture row: Cop who sought VRS posted as Belagavi DCP

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Stock market recommendations: Bajaj Broking Research suggests a positive outlook for the Nifty and Bank Nifty, anticipating potential uptrends with key support levels identified. UPL and Varun Beverages are highlighted as top stock picks, with buy ranges specified based on technical analysis indicating potential breakouts and upward movement in the coming months.
title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for July 18; check list

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: A birthday album made for Jeffrey Epstein's 50th birthday, featuring a controversial letter purportedly signed by Donald Trump, has resurfaced. The letter includes a suggestive drawing and text, which Trump vehemently denies creating, threatening a lawsuit against The Wall Street Journal. US vice president JD Vance has criticized the report.
title: Trump threatens to sue WSJ over 'birthday' note to Epstein; what did the letter say?

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Austrian daredevil Felix Baumgartner, famously known as “Fearless Felix,” who made history with his 2012 stratosphere skydive, tragically passed away in a paragliding accident in Italy at the age of 56. Baumgartner became the first human to break the sound barrier in freefall during the Red Bull Stratos mission.
title: Video | Remembering 'Fearless Felix': Watch his historic jump from the edge of space

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The United States has designated The Resistance Front (TRF), a proxy of Lashkar-e-Taiba, as a Foreign Terrorist Organization and Specially Designated Global Terrorist. TRF claimed responsibility for the deadly April 22, 2025, Pahalgam attack that killed 26 civilians and has conducted multiple assaults on Indian security forces.
title: What is TRF? Lashkar's proxy behind Pahalgam attack; now, a US-designated terror group

author: TNN
description: The ED filed a chargesheet against Robert Vadra, Sonia Gandhi's son-in-law, accusing him of laundering proceeds from a Gurgaon land deal worth over Rs 58 crore. Vadra and 11 others are implicated in the case, involving Onkareshwar Properties. Vadra's office claims a political witch hunt, vowing to defend against the charges.
title: ED chargesheet against Robert Vadra in Gurgaon land case

author: TNN
description: Meta's auto-translation tool incorrectly translated a condolence message, announcing the death of Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah. Enraged by the inaccurate translation, which referred to him as "late," Siddaramaiah demanded Meta suspend the Kannada auto-translation feature. He emphasized the potential harm to public understanding and trust caused by such errors in official communication.
title: ‘Killed’ by Meta, CM Siddaramaiah asks tech company to stop translations

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Brazilian President Lula da Silva has strongly criticized US President Donald Trump's decision to impose a 50% tariff on Brazilian imports, asserting Brazil's sovereignty and rejecting foreign interference. Lula accused US tech firms of spreading misinformation and announced plans to regulate and tax them. The escalating trade dispute has boosted Lula's approval ratings as Brazil considers retaliatory measures.
title: 'No gringo is...': Brazil's Lula slams US president over 50% tariff

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Aamir Khan and Genelia D’Souza's ‘Sitaare Zameen Par’ has grossed ₹163.50 Cr in its first 28 days, maintaining a steady pace despite a mid-week drop. The film, directed by RS Prasanna, blends emotions, humour, and a social message, receiving 3.5 stars from Times of India. The movie now faces competition from Mohit Suri’s ‘Saiyaara’.
title: ‘Sitaare Zameen Par’: Aamir Khan starrer maintains steady pace; mints Rs 163 crore

author: TNN
description: In Chhatarpur, Madhya Pradesh, a dhaba owner faced humiliation. He was forced to do sit-ups by a group. His eatery, named after a Hindu deity, served non-vegetarian food. Activists from Hindu Jodo Sangathan confronted Gyanchand Chaurasia. They demanded he change the name of Krishna Dhaba Biryani Express. Police have registered a case against three individuals and are investigating the matter.
title: ‘Krishna Dhaba Biryani Express’: Dhaba owner in MP forced to do sit ups over title

author: VASANTHA KUMAR
description: A judicial commission has implicated Royal Challengers Sports Pvt Ltd (RCSPL), event organizers, KSCA officials, and senior police officers for the Bengaluru stadium stampede that resulted in 11 deaths. The commission highlighted failures in obtaining necessary permissions and inadequate security arrangements, pointing to a nexus between police and organizers.
title: Bengaluru stampede: Panel holds 11 RCB, KSCA, DNA officials, cops liable

author: KP SAIKIRAN
title: Body shaming, digital abuse punishable under Kerala’s new anti-ragging law

author: SIDDHARTHA DUTTA
title: ‘Don’t mess with India’: Amit Shah hails PM Modi over Op Sindoor

author: IP SINGH
description: Relatives of Amritpal Singh Dhillon, arrested for the hit-and-run that killed marathoner Fauja Singh, visited the bereaved family to offer condolences. Amritpal, who works in Canada, claimed ignorance of hitting the legendary runner. Despite his remorse, he failed to take responsibility, fleeing the scene and attempting to remain hidden. Police apprehended him using headlight fragments, CCTV, and witness testimonies.
title: Fauja Singh death: Kin of accused visit family; son says ‘he should’ve stopped, helped’

author: MUKUT DAS
description: In a move anticipated to bolster the BJP's prospects ahead of the 2026 assembly elections, former Ulfa deputy commander-in-chief Drishti Rajkhowa and AAP's Assam unit ex-president Manoj Dhanowar have joined the party.
title: Former Ulfa deputy chief, Assam’s AAP ex-chief join BJP

author: DHANANJAY MAHAPATRA
description: The Centre has informed the Karnataka High Court that unchecked unlawful content on social media threatens democracy. It accused X of evading accountability under the IT Act's 'safe harbour' provision, arguing this protection isn't absolute but depends on responsible conduct. The government emphasized that social media platforms have a responsibility to regulate content due to their ability to amplify information.
title: Illegal content on X endangers democracy, says government

author: KP SAIKIRAN
description: A 16-year legal fight over toddy strength concludes. Kerala has increased the permissible alcohol content. The new limit is 8.98%. This replaces the 8.1% cap from 2007. The Supreme Court directed a scientific study. An expert panel reviewed samples. The decision supports the traditional toddy sector. A gazette notification is expected soon.
title: Kerala raises legal toddy alcohol limit

author: TNN
description: Tragedy struck Bihar as lightning claimed 19 lives across 10 districts in a single day, with Nalanda experiencing the highest number of fatalities. Chief Minister Nitish Kumar expressed his condolences and announced compensation for the victims' families. An alert has been issued for heavy rain, thunder, and lightning in several districts, urging residents to stay indoors and follow safety advisories.
title: Lightning kills 19 in 24 hours in Bihar

author: SOMIT SEN
description: Maharashtra government will take legal action against individuals identified as 'Crypto-Christians'. These individuals allegedly misuse their Hindu and reserved caste status. They secure educational, employment, and electoral benefits. Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis addressed the legislative council on this serious issue. The government is also considering an anti-conversion bill. However, voluntary religious conversions will not be banned.
title: ‘Crypto-Christians’ misusing caste benefits to face action: CM Fadnavis
